Posts.Content: liveit56 wrote: Hospital called me after I had my mammogram done and said that they see changes in my mammogram from last year...I was having  them done every six months because of LCIS but they finally said that I could go back to a year. Things have been normal since 2004 and now this.   I guess I am just in shock still that they saw a change.. I feel no lump or see any difference.   They want me to have a core biopsy with marker...they said it will take about an hour and a half and I will have to lay on my stomach and my breast will go through these holes in this special table,they will numb my breast and do the biopsy and place the marker and do scan to see if marker in in correct place...this scares me to death. I feel like I can't breathe sometimes...my family knows what is going on and are very supportive but just wish this was all over....I go on the 28th wanted to wait till after Christmas. I will keep all of you in my prayers and any advice about the biopsy would very much appreciated. Merry Christmas and bless you all!  Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2012 01:08PM liveit56 wrote: I had core biopsy laying on table with breast put in hole in table and they numbed the breast...they did the biopsy which I felt no pain but some pressure...then after they did apply a lot of pressure... I did have to ask if it was normal to feel this much pressure and she said yes and that she was sorry but, they have to do it for the bleeding...she did try to reasure me that I was doing really good and we were almost done....afterwards they did mammograms which wasn't to bad but I did bleed some... then they put steri strips on the incision and put a bandage wrap around my breast that I had to wear for 24 hours...wasn't to bad just uncomfortable.  I think what ever we have to go through it is going to be difficult...just no getting out of it.

Posts.Content: Dec 21, 2011 02:58PM liveit56 wrote: Been awhile since I have been back here.... just got a call after my mammogram... they said they see changes in my mammogram and want to do core biopsy w/marker.   I am scared and feel like I am in a dream and want wake up.   I had been diagnosed with LCIS and was keeping check with mammograms and self check and ultra sound and all had been good up until now...I go on the 28th, wanted to wait till after Christmas. I have told my family and have good support but, I am so worried about having this done.... they say you have to lay on your stomach and the test takes about an hour and a half...I am a plus size woman especially around my middle and I haven't been able to lay on my stomach since my hysterectomy...I sure hope I can do this because I just want this over with...they said I should not feel any pain but some pressure, that my breast will go into these holes that are in the table and they will do the biopsy and put the marker in, there will be no stitches and I want know the results for 24 to 48 hours. Did you all have about the same procedure? Did you feel any pain? was laying on your stomach difficult for that long of time? Any advice would be greatly appreciated.   I will keep you all in my prayers and good to know that there is someone to talk to that understands how I am feeling.

Posts.Title: Newbie - Biopsy on 12/29 Karen627 liveit56

Posts.Content: liveit56 wrote: B9 is all I could here her say...waiting this long to here those words. She assured me that the changes that they saw were B9....they know I was diagnosed with LCIS in 2007 so she said the diagnoses is still the same and that the previously seen microcalcifications are no longer evident....no mass, suspicious microcalcification, or skin abnormality is otherwise seen...that is what the report said.  I need to follow up in June with mammogram. I am so glad this is over with and hope I or any one else has to go through anything like this again.  This could have all been avoided had someone just done there job right and not kept passing the blame on someone else....they were all to blame including myself for being afraid to speak up..now I know what my rights are, with the advice from all of you.  I will have a new doctor and will be having my mammograms at another facilty. Thank you all for your support and advice...will keep all of you in my prayers. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Finally got results!!!! liveit56 dawny

Posts.Content: Jan 19, 2012 11:37AM liveit56 wrote: Thank you all for the good wishes...right back to you all.  This has been a hard time but, there are others that are going through much worse than I can imagine...we all need the support of our love ones, friends and, places like this that lets us know we are not alone.  Thank you all again for being there and just listening to me and giving me the support to speak up for myself.  I still have to have my mammograms every six months and the ultra sounds.  I am changing  my medical doctor and will be going to another facility that will be doing my test so, hopefully what has happen will not happen again...I have learned a lot about my self. My BS is wonderful and I am lucky to have her on my side...mistakes do happen and it's how you handle them and how knowledgeable you are about what your rights are. I did not handle them right and I panicked...that is why this site is so important...you get the knowledge here from ones that know and have lived it and still living it. Good luck to you all and you are in my thoughts and prayers. Cathy
